creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: chaotic fight scene between centaurs and nude women; figures are fighting with arrows, ceramics, shields, daggers, etc.
inscription:
Signature, Inscription, Stamp

-- inscribed in plate at bottom edge: [CVM .PRIVILEGIO .REGIS.]
-- in graphite on verso: I3M 292 | RD. 288 | 1est | avant NO
markings: black stamp on verso, bottom center: P. von Baldinger-Seidenberg (Lugt 212); unidentified blue stamp(s) at lower left, not in Lugt
provenance: P. von Baldinger-Seidenberg, Stuttgart, sale 1912; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Combat of Centaurs and Lapiths, and Hippodamia Abducted by a Centaur, From Combats and Triumphs, Plate 8
